body_html: The slim batch_norm wrapper normalizes over the last dimension of your input tensor. So if it's a 2D input tensor coming from a fully connected layer, it normalizes over batch, and thus performs per-activation normalization. If it's a 4D tensor coming from a convolution, it will normalize over the three first dimensions (batch, width, depth), and thus perform per-feature normalization. @sguada maybe forth being a bit more descriptive about this.
